content:
MethodCall Class

In this Article

Implements the IMethodCallMessage interface to create a request message that acts as a method call on a remote object.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.CLSCompliant(false)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Security.SecurityCritical]
public class MethodCall : System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodCallMessage, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • MethodCall

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The MethodCall class is used by the remoting infrastructure of the .NET Framework. You do not need to create an instance of the MethodCall class directly; instead, use the IMethodCallMessage interface.

MethodCall contains remoting data that is passed between message sinks. A remoting client sends a MethodCall message to a server.

Constructors summary

MethodCall(Header[])

Initializes a new instance of the MethodCall class from an array of remoting headers.
MethodCall(IMessage)

Initializes a new instance of the MethodCall class by copying an existing message.

Fields summary

ExternalProperties

An IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.
InternalProperties

An IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

Properties summary

ArgCount

Gets the number of arguments passed to a method.
Args

Gets an array of arguments passed to a method.
HasVarArgs

Gets a value that indicates whether the method can accept a variable number of arguments.
InArgCount

Gets the number of arguments in the method call that are not marked as out parameters.
InArgs

Gets an array of arguments in the method call that are not marked as out parameters.
LogicalCallContext

Gets the LogicalCallContext for the current method call.
MethodBase

Gets the MethodBase of the called method.
MethodName

Gets the name of the invoked method.
MethodSignature

Gets an object that contains the method signature.
Properties

Gets an IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.
TypeName

Gets the full type name of the remote object on which the method call is being made.
Uri

Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the remote object on which the method call is being made.

Methods summary

GetArg(Int32)

Gets a method argument, as an object, at a specified index.
GetArgName(Int32)

Gets the name of a method argument at a specified index.
GetInArg(Int32)

Gets a method argument at a specified index that is not marked as an out parameter.
GetInArgName(Int32)

Gets the name of a method argument at a specified index that is not marked as an out parameter.
GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

The GetObjectData method is not implemented.
HeaderHandler(Header[])

Initializes an internal serialization handler from an array of remoting headers that are applied to a method.
Init()

Initializes a MethodCall.
ResolveMethod()

Sets method information from previously initialized remoting message properties.
RootSetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

Sets method information from serialization settings.

Constructors

  • MethodCall(Header[])

    Initializes a new instance of the MethodCall class from an array of remoting headers.

    public MethodCall (System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.Header[] h1);

    Parameters

    • h1
      Header[]

      An array of remoting headers that contains key/value pairs. This array is used to initialize MethodCall fields for headers that belong to the namespace "http://schemas.microsoft.com/clr/soap/messageProperties".

    Remarks

    The MethodCall class is used by the remoting infrastructure of the .NET Framework. You do not need to create an instance of the MethodCall class directly; instead, use the IMethodCallMessage interface.

  • MethodCall(IMessage)

    Initializes a new instance of the MethodCall class by copying an existing message.

    public MethodCall (System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage msg);

    Parameters

    • msg
      IMessage

      A remoting message.

    Remarks

    The MethodCall class is used by the remoting infrastructure of the .NET Framework. You do not need to create an instance of the MethodCall class directly; instead, use the IMethodCallMessage interface.

Fields

  • ExternalProperties

    An IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

    protected System.Collections.IDictionary ExternalProperties;

    Remarks

    The ExternalProperties field is also accessible through the Properties property.

  • InternalProperties

    An IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

    protected System.Collections.IDictionary InternalProperties;

Properties

  • ArgCount

    Gets the number of arguments passed to a method.

    public int ArgCount { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      A Int32 that represents the number of arguments passed to a method.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • Args

    Gets an array of arguments passed to a method.

    public object[] Args { get; }

    Property Value

    • Object[]

      An array of type Object that represents the arguments passed to a method.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • HasVarArgs

    Gets a value that indicates whether the method can accept a variable number of arguments.

    public bool HasVarArgs { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the method can accept a variable number of arguments; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • InArgCount

    Gets the number of arguments in the method call that are not marked as out parameters.

    public int InArgCount { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      A Int32 that represents the number of arguments in the method call that are not marked as out parameters.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • InArgs

    Gets an array of arguments in the method call that are not marked as out parameters.

    public object[] InArgs { get; }

    Property Value

    • Object[]

      An array of type Object that represents arguments in the method call that are not marked as out parameters.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • LogicalCallContext

    Gets the LogicalCallContext for the current method call.

    public System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.LogicalCallContext LogicalCallContext { get; }

    Property Value

    • LogicalCallContext

      The LogicalCallContext for the current method call.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • MethodBase

    Gets the MethodBase of the called method.

    public System.Reflection.MethodBase MethodBase { get; }

    Property Value

    • MethodBase

      The MethodBase of the called method.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • MethodName

    Gets the name of the invoked method.

    public string MethodName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains the name of the invoked method.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • MethodSignature

    Gets an object that contains the method signature.

    public object MethodSignature { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      A Object that contains the method signature.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • Properties

    Gets an IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

    public virtual System.Collections.IDictionary Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDictionary

      An IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

    Remarks

    The Properties property returns the value of the ExternalProperties field.

  • TypeName

    Gets the full type name of the remote object on which the method call is being made.

    public string TypeName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains the full type name of the remote object on which the method call is being made.

  • Uri

    Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the remote object on which the method call is being made.

    public string Uri { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The URI of a remote object.

Methods

  • GetArg(Int32)

    Gets a method argument, as an object, at a specified index.

    public object GetArg (int argNum);

    Parameters

    • argNum
      Int32

      The index of the requested argument.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The method argument as an object.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • GetArgName(Int32)

    Gets the name of a method argument at a specified index.

    public string GetArgName (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the requested argument.

    Returns

    • String

      The name of the method argument.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • GetInArg(Int32)

    Gets a method argument at a specified index that is not marked as an out parameter.

    public object GetInArg (int argNum);

    Parameters

    • argNum
      Int32

      The index of the requested argument.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The method argument that is not marked as an out parameter.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • GetInArgName(Int32)

    Gets the name of a method argument at a specified index that is not marked as an out parameter.

    public string GetInArgName (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the requested argument.

    Returns

    • String

      The name of the method argument that is not marked as an out parameter.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.

  • GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

    The GetObjectData method is not implemented.

    public void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);

    Parameters

    • info
      SerializationInfo

      The data for serializing or deserializing the remote object.

    • context
      StreamingContext

      The context of a certain serialized stream.

    Remarks

    The GetObjectData method throws a NotSupportedException.

  • HeaderHandler(Header[])

    Initializes an internal serialization handler from an array of remoting headers that are applied to a method.

    public virtual object HeaderHandler (System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.Header[] h);

    Parameters

    • h
      Header[]

      An array of remoting headers that contain key/value pairs. This array is used to initialize MethodCall fields for headers that belong to the namespace "http://schemas.microsoft.com/clr/soap/messageProperties".

    Returns

    • System.Object

      An internal serialization handler.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object. The value of the first header in the input array is the method name.

  • Init()

    Initializes a MethodCall.

    public virtual void Init ();
  • ResolveMethod()

    Sets method information from previously initialized remoting message properties.

    public void ResolveMethod ();

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object. The value of the MethodBase property is set through the ResolveMethod method.

  • RootSetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

    Sets method information from serialization settings.

    public void RootSetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext ctx);

    Parameters

    • info
      SerializationInfo

      The data for serializing or deserializing the remote object.

    • ctx
      StreamingContext

      The context of a given serialized stream.

    Remarks

    The method belongs to a remote object.
